section.class: s_cover parallax s_parallax_is_fixed bg-black-50 pb0 pt152 s_parallax_no_overflow_hidden

p.font: Information for our viewers and guests

font.font: Driving pleasure in the mountains of Graubünden - the Lenzerheide Motor Classics are performance demonstrations without timekeeping, ranking, speed limits and noise regulations.

The route of the Lenzerheide Motor Classics 2020 leads over 2.45 km from the beginning of the village Lenzerheide along the lake to the valley station Rothorn and further via Dieschen sot past the sports center back to the village entrance.
The drivers have 2 sessions of 25 minutes each on one day, a total driving time of around 2 hours all weekend or almost 100 km of driving pleasure in the Graubünden mountains.
Many unique rarities are allowed, from classic cars and historical vehicles / racing vehicles to motorcycles.

tr.td:
Arrive at the racing grounds,
opening the paddock and racing office

Guided vehicle parade through Lenzerheide
Presentation and presentation of vehicles and motorcycles in the
village center of Lenzerheide. Aperitif for drivers.

font.font: Several demonstration trips take place on the 2.45 km long circuit.

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(56, 49, 45); font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

font.font: Experience the Lenzerheide Motor Classics from the driver's perspective and book a taxi ride as a passenger with one of our licensed racing drivers.

p.style: box-sizing: inherit; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(56, 49, 45); font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

font.font: Tickets are available from the information / merchandising stands at the start or from the Rothorn valley station.

font.font: road from Valbella junction Hauptstrasse / Voa davos Lai is generally closed

font.font: The bypass is given via Voa davos Lai / Seestrasse.
Hourly access and departure is guaranteed for 10 minutes.

font.font: From there you can reach the valley station Rothorn, resp.
the race track on foot in about 10 to 15 minutes over the lake dam, along the Heidsee.
